Now it’s your time to share a memory below 👇that you have around #IndependenceDay and for everyone to enjoy.

The mic is all yours! 🎙️ #BewakoofAsks

Now you might be thinking that this is an ✨inspirational post✨. 𝙎𝙤𝙧𝙧𝙮 𝙙𝙤𝙨𝙩𝙤!

This year as well I am not in my hometown to celebrate this auspicious day. 
But I can keep you updated about that uncle, his mustache, nails and his everyday running.

But one day, maa called and shared with me the horrible news of how that uncle slipped and dislocated his knee while running 😔

We still don’t know how that uncle is doing or if he is still planning on continuing his Independence Day ritual.
@RishabhBahuguna Sure thing, Rishabh! Thank you for your understanding.

But anyway, life continued and I moved out of the colony to pursue my college 🎒, job and then another job 💼and so on.

I forgot all about this uncle, his mustache, nails, running and his patriotism.

He would then request kids of the colony to come and sing the national anthem with him, while saluting each of them.
                                           🫡
                                🫡 🫡 🫡 🫡 🫡 🫡

Everyday, he had a fixed routine to wake up early and go running 🏃‍♂️
But he used to break his routine for every 15th of August.

He used to wake up early, dress up in his special white kurta and hoist the Indian flag in his garden 🇮🇳

He was a retired Government employee, with a mustache 👨 as long as his toenails (not at all kidding).

Not going by his nails, that uncle was really self-disciplined and enthusiastic about the Independence Day.
This story is about an uncle who used to stay grumpy 364 days of the year, except for that one day - 𝗜𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗽𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝗗𝗮𝘆 🇮🇳

Today, the admin wants to share a very personal story with you.
So please spare 2 mins and read it till the end.

Toh chalo, shuru karte hai 👇
